title: News: Line up confirmed for London Popfest 2013
body:
With just over four weeks until this year’s London Popfest, the line-up has almost been finalised.

Taking place across three venues in London, this year’s event boasts appearances from Cambridge based [Hong Kong in the 60s,](http://hongkonginthe60s.com/) The Orchids from Glasgow and [Burning Hearts](http://burningheartsmusic.com/biography/) all the way from Finland.

Ok, I’m not going to lie, when I first heard about London Popfest I wasn’t instantly sold. Staccato electric guitar and vocals lost in reverb all seemed pretty 2005. So I pulled together a Spotify playlist of some of the artists at this year’s festival. Two weeks later I’ve got my ticket, my tambourine and I’m more twee than [this guy](http://www.qromag.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/labradorinterviewa.jpg "Johan Angergard, KING OF TWEE").

Tickets are available at: [londonpopfest.com/](http://londonpopfest.com/)

**Friday 1 March at the Grosvenor**

Young Romance 8:15  
Burning Hearts 9:00  
English Singles 9:45  
Milky Wimpshake 10:30

(How Does It Feel to Be Loved? at the Canterbury Arms in Brixton for post-gig dancing!)

**Saturday 2 March at 100 Club**

Big Wave 4:00  
The Tuts 4:50  
The Garlands 5:40  
Martha 6:30  
September Girls 7:20  
This Many Boyfriends 8:10  
Speedmarket Avenue 9:00  
Standard Fare 10:00

(dancing until very late!)

**Sunday 3 March at the Lexington (please note early start!)**

Hong Kong in the 60s 3:45  
Flowers 4:30  
Cocoanut Groove 5:15  
The Orchids 6:15

Taking place across three venues in London, this year’s event boasts appearances from Cambridge based Hong Kong in the 60s, The Orchids from Glasgow and Burning Hearts all the way from Finland.
